synopsis: In this engaging episode, hosts Devam and Ahir sit down with Rishabh Meswani, founder of the Fremont Debate Academy, to explore the transformative power of debate in education and personal growth. The conversation touches on the challenges of leadership, the importance of communication, and the impact of extracurricular activities on youth, all while sharing personal anecdotes and reflections that resonate with listeners.
quotes: The worst case scenario is never as bad as you think it will be.
Life is about trade-offs; sometimes you have to sacrifice one passion for another.
You can't let one bad experience define your entire journey.
Everyone should feel like they're getting something out of their involvement.
It's important to find something you're passionate about and enjoy doing.
Communication is key; it can turn a toxic environment into a supportive one.
You have to give yourself the chance to explore different interests.
Just because you think you have to do something, doesn't mean you should.
The quality of our programs improves when we put in more effort and time.
Sometimes the best way to learn is to embrace discomfort.
